Package com.andreamazzon.session3.encapsulation.logarithm

Class LogarithmCalculator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.andreamazzon.session3.encapsulation.logarithm.LogarithmCalculator
  • public class LogarithmCalculator
extends java.lang.Object
    This class illustrates an use of encapsulation, i.e., wrapping data and methods within classes in combination with access control. In particular, its task is the computation of the logarithm of a given number. However, we want this number to be positive, because the logarithm of a negative number is not defined. This is achieved by making the field hosting the value to be private, so that it is possible to set it only by a public setter. Setters and getters are in general public (or sometimes package access) methods that allow to set and get the value of a private field. Here for example we want our double value to be positive, so it is set only if it is positive.
    Author:
    Andrea Mazzon
